item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 1:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Audio Decomposition – open-source seperation of music to constituent instruments (107 points | 22 comments)
2. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (495 points | 57 comments)
3. Mind-Bending Soviet Era Oil Rig City on the Caspian Sea (52 points | 14 comments)
4. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (496 points | 155 comments)
5. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (98 points | 18 comments)
6. NYC Subway Station Layouts (227 points | 68 comments)
7. 19th Century Map Shows a Fictional Country Created by a Con Man (10 points | 3 comments)
8. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (144 points | 21 comments)
9. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (221 points | 82 comments)
10. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (140 points | 96 comments)
11. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (371 points | 76 comments)
12. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (132 points | 65 comments)
13. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (196 points | 111 comments)
14. Measuring keyboard-to-photon latency with a light sensor (2023) (23 points | 8 comments)
15. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (25 points | discuss)
16. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (75 points | 20 comments)
17. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (306 points | 47 comments)
18. When machine learning tells the wrong story (169 points | 15 comments)
19. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (24 points | 2 comments)
20. Grim Fandango (244 points | 79 comments)
21. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (107 points | 11 comments)
22. Texture-Less Text Rendering (197 points | 48 comments)
23. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (206 points | 81 comments)
24. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (140 points | 72 comments)
25. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (186 points | 72 comments)
26. Notes on Guyana (154 points | 110 comments)
27. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (548 points | 190 comments)
28. You too can write a book (160 points | 56 comments)
29. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (303 points | 133 comments)
30. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (167 points | 56 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 1:15 PM UTC
